Author: Sally Ward-Foxton
Keywords: Business Topics, Components, Converters, Electromechanical, Mergers & Acquisitions, Power, Power Supplies, Startups
Article: CUI Global has agreed to sell its power supply business to Bel Fuse for $32.0 million. This announcement follows the news last month that CUI Global had sold its electromechanical components business. Combined, these announcements represent an almost total exit from the electronics industry. “This transaction unlocks the substantial value in our power and electromechanical segment and is an important step in our transformation into a diversified energy services platform that is grounded in our existing product portfolio and gas infrastructure capabilities,â said Jim O'Neil, CEO of CUI Global, in a statement. OâNeil, who replaced previous CEO William Clough at the beginning of October, also said that CUI Global plans to move forward with an aggressive acquisition strategy in the electric power, oil and gas, and telecommunication infrastructure industries. Clough remains with the company as executive chairman, president and chief legal officer.
